728297f-a.text:
Amboy Road1 The family lives in the tar-paper shack
while the brick house grows.
1924.
P.L. Sperr

Captain Roald Anundsen Plasa, at Amboy Road.
My 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr,

729375f-b.text:
(1)
Richmond Road, at the S.W. corner of Amboy Road, showing the Black Horse Tavern. It was a resort of British officers during the Revolution.
Fhbruary 22, 1883
Photo by Bradish J. Carroll
From william T. Davis Collection through P.L.Sperr. (2)  The Elack Horse Tavern, years later.
About 1910
By Mulford Simonson
Prom P.L.Sperr Collection.
(3)
At a later date.
April 30, 1929
P.L.Sperr

729376f-a.text:
Richmond Road (right, tracks thereon), at the S.W. corner of Amboy Road, showing the Black Horse Tavern. It dates back to preRevolutionary days and was a popular gathering place for British
officers during the War for Independence.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.
